channel.title: Unix/Linux
channel.description:
well, i decided to switch over to linux/unix completely for the sole reason of programming, i find using the console is far better than doing it on windows, and who doesn't like the Vi editor.
i tried ubuntu, but didn't like it much (maybe since its name is of African origin), i am going with fedora, which is much close to red hat enterprise, which my university uses.\
well now i have a problem, fedora won't connect to my wireless network, works sometimes but majority of the time it won't work, i am sure its not a driver problem, any guess??
and any experience with fedora?

item.title: Unix/Linux
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I also seemed to have forgotten to mention than Unix and Linux cannot be used interchangeably, everyone agrees on that.

Opinions are like assholes on the difference though (everyone has one, and all of them stink), my opinion is that Linux is Unix but not every Unix is Linux (such as FreeBSD).

Read full topic

and who doesn’t like the Vi editor.

item.title: Unix/Linux
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What kind of security do you have on the wireless network? My desktop (a hardware issue, because it happens on windows and linux) randomly changes the 3rd field in the MAC address between 00 and 16, which would be an issue if it was connected wirelessly and I had MAC filtering enabled.

Read full topic
